description.narrative: The Project development objective is to improve integrated urban management, service delivery, and disaster emergency management in Western Area and secondary cities of Sierra Leone.

participating-org.narrative: Fiscal Decentralization Division in Ministry of Finance

Actual end date of the activity

Planned start date of the activity

mailing-address.narrative: The World Bank, 1818 H Street, NW, Washington, DC 20433 USA

description.narrative: Total Commitment in Second Quarter of 2021
Total Disbursement in Fourth Quarter of 2021
Total Disbursement in Third Quarter of 2021

condition.narrative: Per the ESCP, the Recipient shall prepare a GBV Action Plan during the first quarter of implementation and approved not later thanninety days of the Effective Date, which will then form part of the Contractors' ESMP.
Per the ESCP, the Recipient shall, not later than sixty days of the Effective Date, prepare a COVID-19 Prevention and RiskManagement Plan, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association.
Per the ESCP, the Recipient shall, not later than thirty days of the Effective Date, hire an NGO to support the GBV Action Planimplementation, including designing the GBV-related GRM.

Schedule 2, Section I.A.2(a): The Recipient shall, at all times during implementation of the Project, maintain the ProjectManagement Unit (PMU) under the FDD with terms of reference, resources and technical staff, satisfactory to the Association,including a Project manager, a financial management specialist or an accountant, a procurement specialist, a civil engineer, amonitoring and evaluation specialist, an environmental specialist, a social specialist, a gender, and gender-based violencespecialist, and a communications and community engagement specialist, all with terms of reference, qualifications, and experience,satisfactory to the Association.

Schedule 2, Section I.A.2(c): The Recipient shall, at all times during the Project implementation, maintain the PFMU within the MoFwith terms of reference, resources and technical staff, satisfactory to the Association. The PFMU shall be responsible for managingthe fiduciary (i.e., financial management and procurement) aspects of the Project.
Schedule 2, Section I.A.3(a): The Recipient shall maintain the Project Steering Committee throughout the Project implementationperiod.
Schedule 2, Section I.A.4(a): The Recipient shall maintain the Project Technical Committee throughout the Project implementationperiod.

Schedule 2, Section I.E: The Recipient shall, not later than sixty (60) days of the Effective Date, establish, operationalize, andthereafter, maintain throughout Project implementation, a grievance mechanism, in form and substance satisfactory to theAssociation.

title.narrative: Beneficiary feedback surveys conducted at mid-term and closing
Flood forecasting and alert systems established
Districts with Disaster Contingency Plans adopted
Emergency Operations Centers (national and regional) established and equipped
Registered grievances resolved within the agreed timeframe
Increased municipal own source revenue (aggregated for all city councils)
People provided with increased access to resilient municipal infrastructure and services
Districts with functional decentralized emergency response services
People with access to new sanitation and/or water facilities constructed
Cities with new planning frameworks adopted
Formal jobs in SWM created by the project, of which female
Proportion of safely disposed municipal solid waste in Western Area
City councils using a citizen engagement platform
City councils with ICT system for property tax upgraded/established and operational
People provided with access to enhanced hydromet early warning systems
Average citizen satisfaction rate with at least 1 subproject provided under Component 2 - Female
Average citizen satisfaction rate with at least 1 subproject provided under Component 2
Women completing the SWM livelihood support program under the project
People provided with increased access to resilient municipal infrastructure and services - Female
City councils staff trained in urban planning methods - Female
Staff trained in urban planning methods
Area of forested land restored and/or under improved management
